PreGraphModeling 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Residualize a numeric vector using a GAM fit from mgcv

    residualize_gam.Rd

    Fit a univariate GAM of y on x (a smooth of x) using mgcv and return residuals.

    residualize_gam(
  y,
  x,
  k = 10,
  bs = "tp",
  method = "REML",
  family = stats::gaussian(),
  use_bam = FALSE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    y

    Numeric vector to be residualized (e.g. sizeFactor).

    x

    Numeric predictor (e.g. saturation).

    k

    Integer, basis dimension for the smooth (passed to mgcv::s). Default 10.

    bs

    Character, smooth basis type (passed to mgcv::s). Default "tp".

    method

    Character, smoothing selection method passed to mgcv::gam/bam. Default "REML".

    family

    A family object for the GAM. Default gaussian().

    use_bam

    Logical, use mgcv::bam instead of mgcv::gam for large data. Default FALSE.

    ...

    Additional arguments passed to mgcv::gam or mgcv::bam.

    Value

    A list with elements:

    residuals

    Numeric vector of residuals (same length as y).

    fitted

    Fitted values from the GAM (NA where fit not possible).

    model

    The fitted mgcv model object (or NULL if not fit).

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
df <- data.frame(sizeFactor = rnorm(200, 10, 2), saturation = runif(200))
out <- residualize_gam(df$sizeFactor, df$saturation, k = 15)
df$sizeFactor_resid <- out$residuals
} # }
